masonGlue
Class ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation

java.lang.Object
  sim.engine.SimState
      masonGlue.ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAgentLocator, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ParametrizedForagingHoneyBeeSimulation
public class ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation
extends sim.engine.SimState
implements sim.engine.Steppable, IAgentLocator

This class hold all information for the simulation. This class implements the simulated world of a hive (Hive), bees (Bee) and food sources (FoodSource). This class does not provide any user interface.

This class implements Steppable and extends the type SimState . Invoking the method step(SimState) will provide an instance of this class.

Copyright 2009 Joerg Hoehne

Author:
hoehne (Jörg Höhne)

Constant Field Values

avoidObstacles

public boolean avoidObstacles
Set it to true if obstacles (other agents) are to be avoided.

maxBees

public int maxBees
The maximum number of bees in the simulation. This value is defined protected only because a parametrizing subclass has to access this property.

comNoise

public double comNoise
The communication problems between bees. It is noise when transferring information.

pForgettingSource

public double pForgettingSource
A value describing the probability a bee forgets its source in every iteration step.

pStartScouting

public double pStartScouting
A value describing the probability to start scouting.

pForagingAgain

public double pForagingAgain
A value describing the probability to forage again if the be returned from foraging.

colonyNectarNeed

public double colonyNectarNeed
The general urge the colony needs some nectar. This is a highly aggregated variable including several aspects.

maxSearchSteps

public int maxSearchSteps
A value describing the maximum steps for a bee searching a food source.

Constant Field Values

environment

public sim.field.continuous.Continuous2D environment
An environment the agents are moving in. This object has to be created in an early stage because it will referenced during the creation of agents because on creation agents will update their location. The locations are stored in the environment object.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Overwritten method for execution of this SimState object.

Overrides:
start in class sim.engine.SimState

step

public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
This method is performed when the next step for the simulation is computed. This simulation does nothing, so nothing is inside the body of the method.

This method is used because this object is placed in the scheduler.

Specified by:
step in interface sim.engine.Steppable
Parameters:
state - The SimState environment, in this simulation an instance of type ForagingHoneyBeeSimulation or ParametrizedForagingHoneyBeeSimulation.

prepareSimulation

private void prepareSimulation()
This method prepares the simulation by creating all necessary objects. This step is not really necessary because this can be done in the method start() that is called prior executing the simulation. But to provide ready initialized objects for an user interface an even prior call is a precondition so the objects are instantiated before even start() is called because the user interface and a model inspector are created before calling start().

initSimulation

private void initSimulation()
This method will be called by the start() method that will start the simulation. The agents are created and placed into the simulation. The method prepareSimulation() is called first to prepare the simulation and provide the user interface with data.

This method places every agent in the scheduler, even those that are created in prepareSimulation().

isOutside

public boolean isOutside(IMovingAgent agent)
Check if the center of the agent is outside the simulation bounds. For every bound on the axis it is checked if it is below the minimum or above or equal the maximum: the maximum value is outside.

Parameters:
agent -
Returns:
True if the agent is outside the boundaries.

addAgent

public boolean addAgent(IMovingAgent agent)
Add an agent to the simulation. The maximum sphere of all objects is computed during successfully adding an agent. Some agent classes are additionally stored in list to provide access in the user interface.

Parameters:
agent -
Returns:
True, if the agent has successfully added; false otherwise.

removeAgent

public boolean removeAgent(IMovingAgent agent)
Remove an agent from the simulation. If the agent has a sphere which represents the maximum radius of all agents spheres the (possible) new maximum sphere is computed.

The agents are also removed from the additional lists if necessary.

Parameters:
agent -
Returns:
True if the agent has been removed, false otherwise (because it has never been stored).

computeMaxAgentSphereRadius

private double computeMaxAgentSphereRadius()
Compute the maximum radius of all agents inside this simulation.

Returns:
The computed maximum sphere currently in the simulation.

updateLocation

public void updateLocation(IMovingAgent agent)
This is a basic glue method demanded by the IAgentLocator interface. This method allows every agent to inform the simulation about a change in the agents location.

Specified by:
updateLocation in interface IAgentLocator
Parameters:
agent - The agent whose location has to be updated.

getObjectsWithinDistance

public java.lang.Object[] getObjectsWithinDistance(IMovingAgent agent,
                                                   double distance)
Compute every agent that is within a certain location from an agent. This method assumes all objects are points so only the objects. Due to the algorithm provided by MASON objects with a distance at least as provided are included.

Parameters:
agent - The agent where to start.
distance - The distance (radius) the returned agents should lie within.
Returns:
All objects that are at least in the distance.

getMaxSphereRadius

public double getMaxSphereRadius()
Return the maximum radius of all agents inside this simulation.

Returns:
The current maximum sphere.
